question.Q: Is the gas expelled by belching?
Can you taste a sour or bitter fluid when you belch, especially if you are bending over or lying down?
See your doctor. You may have GASTROESOPHAGEAL REFLUX DISEASE.
Do you often have a bloated, uncomfortable feeling after meals?
You may be unconsciously swallowing air while you eat and then regurgitating it to relieve your discomfort.
See your doctor. You probably swallow large amounts of air without realizing it while eating or chewing gum or as a nervous habit.
Have you recently eaten large quantities of high-fiber foods such as beans, bran, or fruit?
Do you have episodes of lower abdominal pain that are relieved by passing gas or having a bowel movement?
See your doctor. You may have IRRITABLE BOWEL SYNDROME.
Are your stools pale, greasy, and foul-smellin ?
See your doctor. You may have an intestinal disorder such as CELIAC DISEASE.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat.
